alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:47AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Nicholas, southwestern Webster, southern Clay and central Fayette Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 147 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Summersville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Oak Hill, Ansted, Camden-On-gauley, Craigsville, Hawks Nest State Park, Camden On Gauley, Powellton, Cowen, Canvas, Muddlety, Swiss, Indore, Nettie, Boggs, Bentree, Calvin and Kesslers Cross Lanes. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 57 and 59. Route 19 between mile markers 11 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for central West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
